result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Processed Financial Request Form

Case called: 3:01 pm
INCLUDES 12CF731, 14CF83, 15CF1129, 17CF768.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Zach Glascock;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
14CF83:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>>DRI.

15CF1129:
Ct. 1 (1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g))>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.

17CF768:
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)-Second and Subsequent Offense-PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 8 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 9 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 11 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>DRI.
Ct. 12 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 13 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
17CF768:
Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 7 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> GUILTY.
Ct. 10 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
17CF768:
Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> 8 Years WSPS, 4 Years IC and 4 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and Buy Money in the amount of $400.00 to be paid on ES, DNA Sample. Court finds 183 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>> 6 Years WSPS, 3 Years IC and 3 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 183 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

Ct. 7 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g)-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> 8 Years WSPS, 4 Years IC and 4 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and Buy Money in the amount of $400.00 to be paid on ES, DNA Sample. Court finds 183 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

Ct. 10 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs)>> 3 Years WSPS, 1 Years IC and 2 Years ES, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 183 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION IN 12CF731:
12CF731:
Revoke DEOJ on Count 1 and Enter Judgment and Finds Defendant Guilty.
COURT ORDERS:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>> 3 Years WSPS, 1 Year IC and 2 Years ES. Court finds 3 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming. Court Costs to be paid while on ES. 

COURT ORDERS: 
BOND MONEY TO BE RETURNED TO THE POSTER C.S. IN FILES POSTED. 

Adjourned: 3:22 pm
